nodes.text: The jury-coercion claim in respondent  s habeas petition is  the same claim rejected on the merits in his direct appeal  to the state appellate court

When a habeas petitioner  s claim has been adjudicated  on the merits in state-court proceedings28 U.S.C.   2254(d)forecloses relief unless the state court  s adjudica-  tion of the claim:    (1)resulted in a decision that was contrary toor  involved an unreasonable application ofclearly es-  tablished Federal lawas determined by the Supreme  Court of the United States;or  (2)resulted in a decision that was based on an un-  reasonable determination of the facts in light of the  evidence presented in the State court proceeding.
